intro: Psychotria alsophila, commonly known as the "Cocaine Plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or greenish flowers. It contains alkaloids, including cocaine, which are found in its leaves. Due to its psychoactive properties, it is both botanically significant and subject to legal restrictions in many countries.
